text: {"answer": "L", "reasoning": "Statements i, ii, iv, and v are incorrect. i) Parties cannot directly appoint experts; the court does. ii) Legal sociology does not follow the same formal logic as legal doctrine. iv) Legal sociology does not recommend using incompatible theories that ignore the isâ€‘ought distinction. v) Swiss law requires reciprocity for recognition of foreign judgments and insolvency decrees, so they are not recognized irrespective of reciprocity.
